¬†@LoveitorleaveitUSA#1 USA¬† Nah fam, people were distinguishing Sex from gender by at least 1945.  Here's Oxford Dictionary citing the American Journal of Psychology :

"1945   Amer. Jrnl. Psychol. 58 228   In the grade-school years, too, gender (which is the socialized obverse of sex) is a fixed line of demarkation, the qualifying terms being ‚Äòfeminine‚Äô and ‚Äòmasculine‚Äô."

Even when psychologists believed in only 2 genders, those same psychologists still admitted sex and gender were not identical.  "Man" and "Woman" were separated from "Male" and "Female"  

Do you know the funny thing about people only finding out about scientific facts like trans people being valid?  People don't know about those things before they know about those things.  I know, shocking.  Calculus and Newtonian physics were discovered by a nerdy virgin who lived in an attic.  None of that changes the fact that both concepts are correct and help humanity understand the world.  

Sorry that we were able to change our minds when presented with new evidence, while you're stuck using old information that experts in that field have thrown out as obsolete.  Hopefully you can join us someday.

text: ¬†@ANA HAS BEEN RESURRECTED¬† If humans can do no harm to the environment whatsoever, lets achieve world peace by detonating all of Earth's nuclear arsenal in Antarctica. I'm sure that'll go smoothly~
author: Hey, It's Ya Boi

text:
¬†@ANA HAS BEEN RESURRECTED¬† https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/csl/assessments/ozone/1998/faq6.html#:~:text=Why%20Has%20an%20Ozone%20Hole,over%20the%20globe%20by%20winds.&text=The%20CFCs%20and%20halons%20in,stratosphere%20mainly%20in%20tropical%20latitudes.

I swear to God you guys love to act like you got gold fish memories. Tell me how the ozone hole over Antarctica formed naturally. I can tell you how we caused it...in the link! 

"Human emissions of chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and halons (bromine-containing gases) have occurred mainly in the Northern Hemisphere. About 90% have been released in the latitudes corresponding to Europe, Russia, Japan, and North America. Gases such as CFCs and halons, which are insoluble in water and relatively unreactive, are mixed within a year or two throughout the lower atmosphere. The CFCs and halons in this well-mixed air rise from the lower atmosphere into the stratosphere mainly in tropical latitudes. Winds then move this air polewardboth north and south from the tropics, so that air throughout the global stratosphere contains nearly equal amounts of chlorine and bromine."

Du Pont, a chemical company that was producing CFCs and halons gases, volunteered to limit or stop their production of CFCs and halon gases before the government(s) took action.

https://www.nytimes.com/1988/03/26/business/behind-du-pont-s-shift-on-loss-of-ozone-layer.html

Now imagine if what I said as a hypothetical joke were to happen, with all the nukes going off in Antarctica...what do you think would happen? I can safely say that there would be little of it left, the fall out radiation would not only do radioactive fuckery in our atmosphere in the south-pole, but also spread throughout the southern hemisphere via wind travel. Now with all the heat of the nukes melting away the ice, I'd say the worse to come from that is the coast lines of the southern hemisphere (if not further north) being underwater.
author: Hey, It's Ya Boi

text:
¬†@ANA HAS BEEN RESURRECTED¬† 
"There was a ban on those aerosols in 1987 and the temperature has been rising since 1850 because we left a mini "ice age"."
Did you not see the illustration in the link I gave you? It showed the ozone hole starting out in 1986.
"Scientists just discovered the ocean hold twice as much c02 as previously thought (because scientists aren't infallible). "
https://www.intelligentliving.co/oceans-twice-as-effective-absorbing-co2/
However, our oceans do absorb more than just CO2. In two somewhat related studies, we reported on just how much heat the oceans may be absorbing, and how an overabundance of CO2 has caused mass toxic algae growth. An international team of researchers had calculated that the oceans collectively absorb heat at a rate of 5 atom bombs per second. In the Canary Islands, another team found that toxic algae blooms happen when CO2 in the water reached high levels.

So while one positive may be that a large mass of CO2 is sunk into our oceans, two negatives may be how quickly they are heating up and the overall marine life which could be lost prior to the CO2 sinking. As tends to be the case with ecosystems, a delicate balance is often required to ensure a harmonious environment.
The ocean doesn't work the same way as plants do (photosynthesis) where the more CO2 (from exhaling) we give plants, the more O2 they give us.
"They also found out magma can move a lot quicker from inside the earth to the surface. I'm not even talking about actual volcanic activity but magma just below the crust of the earth which would heat the earth and the oceans. Scientists have already stated they need to rethink how magma operates."
Then let's cut our emissions so that the oceans are only affected by the magma without excess CO2 going into the ocean. I know, me suggesting to cut CO2 emmisions will most likely prompt you to go WhY bOtHeR!? Because we want to buy ourselves more time to adjust to the inevitable change to our climate. We've already passed the point of no return and we can't go back to how things used to be before we made climate change a major issue because of the hesitation and negligence of our leaders.
"We didn't cause the laurentide ice sheet or the thermal maximum and they were insane  demonstrations of climate change. Magnetic North is moving more than scientists predicted which means the inside of the earth is moving in ways we've never seen before."
You're talking about those instances as if what we can do will make no difference (not even my nuking Antartica joke), I beg to differ:
https://scialert.net/fulltext/?doi=jest.2016.301.316
